alert.note: Alert for Juncos; Trujillo Alto (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 6:10AM ADT until September 19 at 8:30AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall along Rio Grande de Loiza and its tributaries, including Rio Gurabo, Rio Cayaguas, Rio Valenciano, Rico Canaboncito, Rio Turabo, Rio Caguitas, and Rio Bairoa. * WHERE...Caguas, Carolina, Gurabo, Juncos, Las Piedras, San Lorenzo and Trujillo Alto. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 4 and 16 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gurabo, San Lorenzo, Juncos, Caguas, Las Piedras, Trujillo Alto, Carolina, Celada, Bairoa, Jagual, El Mango and Pueblito Del Rio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
